title: Take Me Back (Imperials song)
text:
"Take Me Back" was a song composed by songwriter <a href="Teddy%20Randazzo">Teddy Randazzo</a>, and was a 1965 hit song by <a href="Little%20Anthony%20and%20the%20Imperials">Little Anthony and the Imperials</a>. 
Background.
"Take Me Back" a ballad about a plea for forgiveness. The song was one of 5 hit singles taken from their 1964 hit album, "Goin' Out of My Head", who also wrote several previous Imperials hit singles, including <a href="Goin%27%20Out%20Of%20My%20Head">Goin' Out Of My Head</a> and <a href="Hurt%20So%20Bad">Hurt So Bad</a>, and was produced by Randazzo and <a href="Don%20Costa">Don Costa</a> for Randazzo's DCP Records label in 1964, released as a single in 1965, and later re-released in 1966 on <a href="United%20Artists">United Artists</a>' Veep Records subsidiary.
"Take Me Back" was a Billboard Top 20 hit for The Imperials, reaching # 16 on the Billboard Hot 100, and a Top 20 R&B hit as well, peaking at # 15.
Personnel.
Producers.
Teddy Randazzo & Don Costa
Chart Performance.
It was a "<a href="Billboard%20%28magazine%29">Billboard</a>" Top 20 Pop Hit, peaking at #16, and was a Top 20 R&B Hit as well, peaking at # 15.
